title: Cup And Saucer, ca. 1925
markings: On underside (a), stamped in blue ink: Wien mark above "Wien" / red ink overglaze: "Augarten / Austria [in rectangle]" / in black: "1/5174 / 53" / "Fr. ZüLoW."; (b) same marks without artist name
provenance: Estate of Edgar Sachs (via Mr. Seymour Askin); Collection of Hilda G. and Edgar Sachs; 2008: acquired by Museum
dimensions:
H x W (a,b: overall): 6 x 15 cm (2 3/8 x 5 7/8 in.)
H x W (a: cup): 13 cm (5 1/8 in.)
H x diam. (b: saucer): 2 x 15 cm (13/16 x 5 7/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of the Estate of Edgar Sachs, from the Collection of Hilda G. and Edgar Sachs
description: Cup and saucer decorated with gold rim and a frieze of comical stylized characters; figures in a boat, a castle, a potted plant, and a horse, among others.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cup And Saucer, ca. 1925.
ca. 1925. Enameled, gilt and glazed porcelain. Gift of the Estate of Edgar Sachs, from the Collection of Hilda G. and Edgar Sachs. 2008-42-14-a,b.
